intro: Psittacanthus minor, commonly known as the lesser bird-of-paradise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored inflorescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a showy, petal-like structure called a spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique floral structure makes it a popular subject in botanical studies and horticulture.
